Package AndeA1_2022

Class Game

java.lang.Object
AndeA1_2022.Game
public class Game extends Object
This class is where the game takes place. When this class refers to the "player" it is referring to the Hand class The game contains a deck, a hand (the player) which is drawn from the deck, and a dragon who is the enemy. The game will take turns consisting of the player playing the first indexed card in their hand (provided they have the energy) The dragon will also deal damage to the player at the same time. The game ends when either the player or the dragon reaches 0 or less health. Both the player and dragon being 0 or less health should result in a draw. The game may also end if the player runs out of cards to draw.
Author:
YOURNAME AND STUDENT ID

  • Method Details

    • playGame

      public String playGame()
      Plays a game which involves having the player and dragon attack each other until a winner is declared. The player will always play the first index card in their hand (if possible) The turn number should be kept track of, and a winner should be checked for at the end of each turn.

      My solution length: 13 lines
      Returns:
      a string in the format of who the winner was and the number of turns (CASE AND SPACING SENSITIVE) eg: The winner was: dragon after 5 turns. The winner was: player after 8 turns. The result was a tie after 10 turns.

    • checkWinner

      public String checkWinner()
      This method checks if any of the win conditions are met If either the player or the dragon, or both have 0 or less health Or if the player has run out of cards in their deck

      My Solution length: 14
      Returns:
      If both have run out of health: tie If the player lost: dragon If the dragon lost: player If neither side has won yet: return an empty string
